definition[0]: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it
example[1]: I’m trying to persuade your dad to buy some shares.
example[2]: Leo wouldn’t agree, despite our efforts to persuade him.
example[3]: He took a lot of persuading to come out of retirement  (=it was hard to persuade him).
example[4]: I finally managed to persuade her to go out for a drink with me.
example[5]: Don’t let yourself be persuaded into buying things you don’t want.
definition[1]: to make someone believe something or feel sure about something
example[6]: I am not persuaded by these arguments.
example[7]: She’ll only take me back if I can persuade her that I’ve changed.
example[8]: McFadden must persuade the jury of her innocence.
example[9]: I persuaded her to change her mind.
example[10]: Do you think you can persuade him to lend us the money?
definition[2]: to persuade someone to do something, especially something they do not really want to do
example[11]: Why did I let you talk me into this?
example[12]: He finally talked her into going on a date with him.
definition[3]: to make someone do something by persuading or asking them
example[13]: If we can’t get a taxi I’ll get Joe to pick us up.
example[14]: I know how to get you to kiss me.
definition[4]: to persuade someone that they should do something, because it is the best or the right thing to do. Some British speakers think this use is incorrect, and prefer to use persuade
example[15]: It would be difficult to convince him to move.
definition[5]: to try to persuade someone to do something, especially because you think it will be good for them
example[16]: Children should be encouraged to read all kinds of books.
definition[6]: to have an effect on what someone decides to do
example[17]: What influences you to buy clothes?
definition[7]: to persuade someone to do something by talking gently and kindly
example[18]: I tried to coax him to eat a little.
definition[8]: to persuade someone to do something by praising them or making promises to them
example[19]: He hoped to cajole her into selling her house.
definition[9]: to persuade or encourage someone to do something wrong or stupid
example[20]: Who put you up to this?
definition[10]: to persuade someone not to do something
example[21]: How do you dissuade young people from experimenting with drugs?
